name: 30 second Chair Stand Assessment number

permissible_values.description: Number of times patient moved from sitting in a chair to standing >=0

definition: Number of times patient moved from sitting in a chair to standing  as a part of the 30 second Chair Stand Assessment
short_description: Number of times patient moved from sitting in a chair to standing  as a part of the 30 second Chair Stand Assessment
references: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention [CDC].(2019). Stopping Elderly Accidents Deaths and Injuries (STEADI) Tool Kit Assessment: 30-second chair stand. Available at https://www.cdc.gov/steadi/pdf/STEADI-Assessment-30Sec-508.pdf

name: 30 second Chair Stand Assessment score

permissible_values.description: 1 =  below average, at risk for falls

definition: A score indicating below average or not below average, based on the number of times a patient moved from sitting in a chair to standing and the person's age,  as a part of the 30 second Chair Stand Assessment. A below average score indicates a risk for falls
short_description: Chair stand score indicating whether the participant's number of times standing is below average or not.
references: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention [CDC].(2019). Stopping Elderly Accidents Deaths and Injuries (STEADI) Tool Kit Assessment: 30-second chair stand. Available at https://www.cdc.gov/steadi/pdf/STEADI-Assessment-30Sec-508.pdf

name: 30 second Chair Stand Assessment
description: The 30 Second Chair Stand Assessment tests leg strength and endurance in older adults. Contains 2 CDEs.
